intro: Hieracium capnotrichum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragweed, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and disturbed soils, often forming dense mats. Its yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Hieracium capnotrichum is an herbaceous perennial that can spread aggressively through rhizomes.
